conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graphs of the car and the truck to determine collision.
The car was traveling at 30 m/s on the highway.
The truck was traveling at 10 m/s 30 meters ahead of the car.
The car's initial velocity is 30 m/s.
The car decelerates at a constant rate, as indicated by the downward slope of the graph.
The car's final velocity is 10 m/s.
The truck's initial velocity is 10 m/s.
The truck decelerates at a constant rate, as indicated by the downward slope of the graph.
The truck's final velocity is 10 m/s.
The distance between the car and the truck is 30 meters.
Calculate the time it takes for the car to stop using the formula t = (vf - vi) / a.
The time it takes for the car to stop is 2/3 seconds.
The distance the car travels during the stopping time is 20 meters.
Calculate the distance between the car and the truck after the car stops: 30 meters - 20 meters = 10 meters.
Compare the distances: the distance after the car stops is 10 meters, initially was 30 meters.
Since the distance between the car and the truck after the car stops is less than the initial distance, the two cars will not collide.
Final Answer: No, the two cars will not collide.
